newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-CBA says has healthy growth appetite.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-CBA says has healthy growth appetite.

text.p: Commonwealth Bank of Australia managing director David Murray said on Thursday the bank was in no hurry to change its dividend payout ratio because it had a healthy apetite for growth and needed capital for growth opportunities.

"We've not been in a hurry to change the dividend policy. We've also got a very healthy apetite for growth for which we need some capital for some purposes," Murray told a Securities Institute of Australia luncheon.
Murray also said any market perceptions that the bank was about to securitise its entire mortgage portfolio and return its capital to shareholders was not correct.
"This is not what is going on," he said.

Murray said the global trend towards more money in mutual funds would increase the pressure for funding mortgages through securitisation but that CBA's portfolio was simply too big for fund managers to handle at the moment.
